name: Byte
summary:
The byte type in Julian language. A byte type has a value range from -128 to 127, so it can be promoted to [int](Integer) without losing precision.

byte type can participate in arithmetic operations such as '+' and '*' and '/'. It can aslo be concatenated to string value with '+' operator in the literal form of this value.

byte is a primitive type. Therefore it can only be assigned to a variable with same type or an [untyped](Any) variable.
